website_summaries.verdict: The Vizio 15.6-inch Thin + Light (CT15-A1) has a gorgeous design and is a decent performer, but a few significant problems mar this ultrabook's debut.
pros: Quick to boot, wake from sleep
cons: Lacks memory card reader, Ethernet port
Short battery life for an ultrabook

customer_reviews.title: till working great with occasional issues that most windows computers have gotten ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this computer for about 2 years now, till working great with occasional issues that most windows computers have gotten in my experience. I love how thin the computer is although its not particularly light (not that its particularly heavy either). the only complaints I have are the keyboard and mouse are not the greatest. the keyboard often double types letters or misses a letter I typed and I have to constantly correct it the mouse isn't bad but it isn't great either. i just attached a wireless one to make my life easier. for its value its a pretty good computer overall
customer_reviews.author: Saul

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Laptop on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop in October 2012 and am using this laptop for 6 months. I did not upgrade it to Windows 8 because of personal preference. Pros: Speed Build Quality Trend Setter Durability Screen Display Cons: Used to be Track Pad. I use this laptop with a mouse and like it very much. Initially there were problems with track pad but as of now I do not have any issues with it. Update 04/27/2014: After light use the screen on this laptop is getting lines and needs repair. The cost of repair for this $264(Parts - $130, Labor - $69,Fedex Shipping - $65).
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: It is thin and light............so it gets two stars. I expected as an ultralight laptop with a solid state hard drive that it would be on instantly when opened. Not the case. Must be rebooted every time. The track pad is one of the poorest designs ever. The cursor goes all over the place like it has a mind of its own. VERY frustrating. We will try to return this and get one that really works well.
customer_reviews.author: H. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because of the Price, Windows 7, Solid State drive, quality of picture etc.....however the mouse and keyboard isn't very user friendly. On the safe side....and after careful consideration, I purchased a Square Trade 3 year warranty since this is Vizio's first computer ever produced. I am certainly glad I did!

customer_reviews.title: slim light and fast
customer_reviews.text: I think it is one of the most thinnest ultrabook. It is only as thin as a cent coin. But it has a fast CPU and SSD. So it boots very fast. And the display is perfect with a full HD resolution. But there are still some disadvantages. The frequency of RAM is only 1333MHz and total memory capacity is 4GB. The occupancy usually goes to 80% when I am surfing the internet. There are only two USB3.0. More is better. And it dosn't have a card reader. The battary life is not so long as the official announcement. I think it can only stand 4 hours if I surf the internet and don't view videos.

customer_reviews.title: Thin and light is true!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is very comfortable to use - the screen is large and easy on the eyes, there is ample space between the keyboard and the edge for resting your wrists while typing, and the keyboard is easy to use. My only complaints - I wish the battery lasted longer, and the mouse pad is a little difficult to use at times. Otherwise this computer is great!

customer_reviews.title: Great Ultrabook with a huge BUT
customer_reviews.text: It's a great ultrabook at an approachable price - if you use an external mouse. The included Sentelic "Finger Sensing Pad" and their drivers is the biggest piece of [...]. If you don't mind your touchpad behaving like it's drunk 75% of the time and sometimes just freezing for a minute or so, this computer is easily 5 stars. I would pay Vizio extra just to switch out this touchpad for a different manufacturer (that's what Asus did with their Zenbooks - they switched to Elan). Update: I got used to the touchpad... slightly. I still think it's bad, but I edited down my review a bit.

customer_reviews.title: It could have been one of the best laptop on the market but I was very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It could have been one of the best laptop on the market but I was very disappointed. The touchpad is terrible to use. Even after a year of using, I still wish I have had a different touchpad. It is not practical to use in taking notes in class because the keyboard is hard to use. There is also about half a second delays between switching from keyboard to touchpad. You have to be very patient in order to deal with these issues. Besides these problems, it is a great laptop, very stable and works well.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome laptop with some minor annoyances
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sleek design, well built, great specs, decent battery life (about 4.5 hours), big gorgeous display, thin+light as the name says Cons: Touchpad is finicky at times, and the keyboard is a bit shallow (both of these issues have been fixed in the newer version of this model) Definitely one of the top ultrabooks on the market right now, great bang for your buck.

product_meta.title: VIZIO Thin and Light CT15-A1 15.6-Inch Laptop
product_meta.description:
With uncompromising performance, and premium picture and audio quality in a remarkably thin profile, the VIZIO Thin + Light is the Ultrabook™ that’s impossible to ignore. But don’t let its thin profile fool you - it outperforms notebooks twice its size. The high-performance 15.6" models each sport a Full HD or HD+ display and premium SRS sound for the best entertainment experience. Powered by the latest Intel Core processors, the VIZIO Thin + Light uses instant-on, flash-based SSD drives for speedy boot-ups and includes Microsoft Signature for fast performance right out of the box. If good things come in small packages, this must be the best there is.
